feels.name: Admiration
feels.quote: He admired Rosamond exceedingly; but that madness which had once beset him about Laure was not, he thought, likely to recur in relation to any other woman.

causedByEvent.name: Admiration of Rosamond's intelligence and beauty

feels.name: Pity
feels.quote: He felt a triumphant delight in his studies, and something like pity for those less lucky men who were not of his profession.

feels.name: Delight
feels.quote: He was an ardent fellow, but at present his ardor was absorbed in love of his work and in the ambition of making his life recognized as a factor in the better life of mankind.

causedByEvent.name: Love of his work and ambition

feels.name: Pleasure
feels.quote: She remained simply serious, turned her long neck a little, and put up her hand to touch her wondrous hair-plaits—an habitual gesture with her as pretty as any movements of a kitten’s paw.

feels.name: Agreeableness
feels.quote: She played admirably. Her master at Mrs. Lemon’s school was one of those excellent musicians here and there to be found in our provinces, worthy to compare with many a noted Kapellmeister in a country which offers more plentiful conditions of musical celebrity.
